Description: Red pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, with remains of four lines of black-painted demotic text on exterior.
Curator's comments: On the acquisition see: B. Muhs and T. Vorderstrasse,' Collecting Egyptian Antiquities in the year 1838: Reverend William Hodge Mill and Robert Curzon, Baron Zouche', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology (2008), pp. 223-245.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (130072) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/130072)
Muhs 2011 / Receipts, Scribes, and Collectiors in Early Ptolemaic Thebes (O Taxes 2) (no.65, p.88-89)
